title: Uber And Other Ride-Sharing Services Give Taxis A Run for Their Money
teaser: Cab drivers say these app-based services unfairly drive down prices, but what is their value?
contentencoded:
The popularity of Uber, Lyft and other mobile app ride-sharing services is threatening to overtake the taxi system. As protests across European revealed, cab drivers say these app-based services side-skirt regulations, aren’t safe and unfairly drive down prices.

NPR’s Elise Hu tells Here & Now’s Jeremy Hobson how these services work and why they’re becoming increasingly valuable.

Guest

  • Elise Hu, NPR technology and culture reporter. She tweets @elisewho.
